entities: Analytical Support and Sanctions Monitoring Team
summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling previous resolutions on the arms embargo on Libya, 
Welcoming the Libyan Political Agreement and the Rome Communiqué, 
Reaffirming commitment to Libya's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and national unity, 
 
Condemns growing terrorist threats, particularly from ISIL (Da’esh) and Al-Qaida-linked groups; 
Expresses concern over unsecured arms and ammunition in Libya; 
Notes the Vienna Communiqué, emphasizing coordination between Libyan military and security forces to combat terrorist groups; 
 
Requests the Government of National Accord (GNA) to appoint a focal point to brief the Committee; 
Affirms GNA's right to submit exemption requests for arms and related materiel to combat ISIL and other terrorist groups; 
Exempts non-lethal military equipment and technical assistance to GNA from prior notification; 
 
Takes note of the final report of the Panel of Experts and the decision of the Council of the European Union to extend EUNAVFOR MED Operation Sophia's mandate to implement the UN arms embargo.
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

 Condemns the flow of arms and related materiel to or from Libya in violation of the arms embargo, including to ISIL and other terrorist groups.

 Urges Member States to combat terrorism in all forms and manifestations.

 Authorizes Member States to inspect vessels on the high seas off the coast of Libya suspected of carrying arms or related materiel in violation of the arms embargo.

 Authorizes Member States to use all measures commensurate to the specific circumstances to carry out inspections, seize and dispose of prohibited items.

 Specifies that authorizations apply only to inspections carried out by warships and ships owned or operated by a State and used only on government non-commercial service.

 Underscores that authorizations do not apply to vessels entitled to sovereign immunity.

 Affirms that authorizations include the authority to divert vessels and their crews to a suitable port to facilitate disposal.

 Requires Member States to submit reports to the Committee on inspections, seizures, and disposal.

 Encourages Member States and the GNA to share relevant information with the Committee.

 Requests the Secretary-General to provide a report on the threat posed by Foreign Terrorist Fighters.

 Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
